title: If Honor level doesn't reflect your account standing, what's the point?
body:
I always thought the objective was to promote good behavior by rewarding you with occasional key fragments, WHILE ALSO serving as a symbol of your status as a player. So should you blow up for ONE game, it'd be taken into consideration. Apparently not, even if your last punishment was 10 months ago with an honor level of 4. 

What's my incentive to making in-game purchases if my account's fate can be decided by one stubborn Rioter? There's no transparency in their rules for what they consider to be an acceptable threshold before mitigating any future punishments. After having been chat restricted once I said that was it, and so it was. Idc what skin sales you come out with. I'd rather spend $3 to grab a new level 30 account if anything else happens. 

Give me a damn good rebuttal as to why anybody with ANY history should bother purchasing from you anymore.
